verses.roman:
dhenukasya saha-bhrātuḥ
pralambasya ca saṅkṣayaḥ
gopānāṁ ca paritrāṇaṁ
dāvāgneḥ parisarpataḥ

synonyms: dhenukasya—of Dhenuka; saha-bhrātuḥ—along with his companions; pralambasya—of Pralamba; ca—and; saṅkṣayaḥ—the destruction; gopānām—of the cowherd boys; ca—and; paritrāṇam—the saving; dāva-agneḥ—from the forest fire; parisarpataḥ—which was encircling.
translation: The Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam tells how Lord Kṛṣṇa and Lord Balarāma killed the demon Dhenukāsura and his companions, how Lord Balarāma destroyed Pralambāsura, and also how Kṛṣṇa saved the cowherd boys from a raging forest fire that had encircled them.
